intro: Pimpinella hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's茴香, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
